thread.title: Myles Garrett, projected no. 1 NFL Draft pick, really wants to sack Tom Brady
thread.title_full: Myles Garrett, projected no. 1 NFL Draft pick, really wants to sack Tom Brady

title: Myles Garrett, projected no. 1 NFL Draft pick, really wants to sack Tom Brady
text:
See Joshua Dobbs, the Tennessee QB? Garrett wants to do this to Tom Brady. Jerome Miron-USA TODAY Sports 
Myles Garrett wants a piece of Tom Brady. 
The highly touted Texas A&M pass rusher, who’s projected by most experts to be the No. 1 overall pick in the 2017 NFL Draft, was asked Saturday at the NFL Scouting Combine which quarterback he most wants to sack. 
His answer: Brady. 
Why? Because he’s a big fan of the New England Patriots QB’s longtime rival. 
Myles Garrett says Tom Brady is the @NFL QB he wants to sack. "I'm a Peyton Manning fan." 
— Andrew Siciliano (@AndrewSiciliano) March 4, 2017 
Barring a trade or a stunning slide down the draft board, Garrett likely won’t get a chance to bring down Brady this season. The teams with the top five picks in the draft — including the Cleveland Browns, who own the first overall selection — all do not have the Patriots on their 2017 regular-season schedules. 
This article first appeared on NESN.com and was syndicated with permission.
